Our local Health Department also gave us guidance that we should adhere to this document as it has not been updated to fully allow ‚Äúhigh contact‚Äù youth sports to normal play.

The KHSAA put out a document that said the ‚ÄúHealthy at work youth guidelines‚Äù specifically governs youth sports only (5th grade and below) and the KHSAA document governs high school and middle school sports only.

Children must be ages 3 or 4 to apply to apply to attend.

Four-year-olds can qualify based on a potential delay or income level.

Applications are also available at the Campbellsville Board of Education and CES offices.

After an application is submitted, children must be screened.

Preschool staff members are working on the safest plan to schedule screenings, and information will be posted when it is available.

For more information, call the Board of Education at (270) 465-4162 or the CES office at (270) 465-4561.

Attention CHS Seniors!

We are celebrating YOU!

Below you will find a list of questions.

Please send the answers and a picture of yourself to Calen McKinney at calen.mckinney@cville.kyschools.us so we can share about you on our social media accounts.

These spotlights will be posted in no particular order. They will be posted just as Ms. McKinney gets the information.

Here are the questions:

1. Name
2. Parent/guardian names
3. Future plans
4. Hobbies and interests
5. Extracurricular activities and sports
6. Favorite class and teacher
6. How are you spending this time away from school?
7. What is something you would like to share about yourself?
8. Yearbook quote

Thanks to all of you who have responded.
